page.title: 11Footpaths: a local walk.
page.content: There are many local footpaths which provide interesting, easy rural walks. Mostly these are over meadows and can be muddy but tracks used by farmers are usually rough and stony. The main attractions are: fresh air, excellent views and an abundance of wildlife. A typical walk in the area starts at Barrowby church, crosses a stile and continues West for about two and a half miles. There are good views across the Trent Valley to the Lincoln Edge.Soon after Breeder Hills Farm, turn North and continue along the Viking Way. Cross the A.52 and continue to the level crossing, turn East alongside the railway to Sedgebrook (old church and abbey house). Return to Barrowby via A.52 and footpath by Blacklands Barn. Before reaching Barrowby Old Hall note medieval ploughing patterns.
